title: Khloé Kardashian's New Self-Help Book Recounts Her Relationship (and Breakup) With Lamar Odom, Doesn't Pull Any Punches
text:
Share Tweet Pin E-mail Khloé Kardashian releases ​ Strong Looks Better Naked , her first self-help book, next month. ​As confirmed by her publisher, the book will feature Khloé's best inspirational advice on developing self-confidence and accepting your "true beauty" in a world that "worships skinny," alongside "revelatory stories of her own struggles with weight, relationships, and her self-image."
And as Page Six notes today, the book will also drill down on Khloé's split from Lamar Odom, which she's credited since with being the catalyst for her fitness regime and greater glamourpuss transformation. As their relationship grew strained, Khloé says she found tabloid speculation "humiliating" and was left suffering "social anxiety" every time she left her house. "You can't control other people, and you can't control the outcome of situations," Khloé writes, which Page Six contextualizes as a passage referring to Lamar's addiction issues specifically, "and if you think you can, you will soon discover that you are sadly mistaken." On a more positive note, Khloé does credit her time with Lamar as some of the best years of her life.
More From Cosmopolitan In related news, Khloé and Lamar filed a petition yesterday asking for their divorce to be called off (which was granted). Lamar is said to have promised Khloé there'll be no more drugs in his future; TMZ adds that he's "repeatedly" told her he loves her. Lamar remains hospitalized in Los Angeles, and Us Weekly says that, while recovering, he still "isn't doing that well." People reports he remains on dialysis and is receiving antibiotics for a respiratory infection; he is also unable to stand up on his own. Khloé did not attend her sister Kim's birthday party Wednesday, preferring to stay with Lamar. "She is still very worried about him, Us 's source says, and uncomfortable with leaving [him]."
